title: Get rid of django-extra-view. Redesign admin-competitions-manager to use Vue.js and API routes
body:
# Description

This PR redesigns the admin-competitions-manager page in order to get rid of the django-extra-view library that was causing some issue.

# Content

The admin-competitions-manager page is accessible to admins at _/admin_competitions_manager/_

It contains a table listing all competitions (paginated).
You can edit the _upper_bound_max_submission_size_ field of any competition by clicking on its value.
If you want to edit this field for multiple competitions at once you can use the checkboxes on the far-left column.
A _select all_ checkbox is also available. Be aware that it will only select all competitions displayed on the current page (because of pagination). If you want to select ALL competitions regardless of what is displayed you can chose to display all competitions then use the _select all_ checkbox.

Once the modification is done you can click on the _Save_ button to save them in the DB (bulk update in one transaction).

Features listed in the #3185 will be done in a separated PR

# Misc. comments

Tested locally

# Reviewers

@bbearce

# Checklist
- [x] Code review by me 
- [x] Hand tested by me 
- [x] I'm proud of my work
- [ ] Code review by reviewer
- [ ] Hand tested by reviewer
- [ ] Ready to merge

title: Compute worker not recognizing when ingestion program exits
body:
I'm organizing this competition: https://competitions.codalab.org/competitions/29853
As of about a week or two ago, it seems like the competitions-v1-compute-worker is failing to recognize when the ingestion_program finishes. I can monitor the ingestion_program worker, and despite the ingestion_program finishing succesfully and exiting, the compute-worker logs still show:
 `[2021-04-27 12:23:48,486: INFO/Worker-1] Checking process, exit_code = None`.  

A new ingestion program image is then created and runs the next submission, despite the previous submission never transitioning to scoring. Therefore in our submission queue we see a lot of "Running" submissions, none of which score until they time out and fail. For example, submission 868157 ran through the full ingestion program but never transitioned to scoring, and then submission 868170 began running before ingestion was completed. Is there a change that happened to CodaLab in the last few weeks that could have caused this? Our entire competition has broken despite running fine beforehand. 

Thanks,
Rob

title: Problem with computer workers running on AWS
body:
If you are an organizer and have problem hosting your competition:
------------------------------------------------------------------

1. If possible, please add `eric2` and `tthomas63` as admins to your competition so they may access it
2. Please post a link to your competition
https://competitions.codalab.org/competitions/24902

If you are having trouble using the site:
-----------------------------------------
Not applicable


Bug description
----------------------
When starting some computer worker on AWS, we are encountering some trouble with the codalab official images, that from time to time lead to this error:
```
File "/worker/worker.py", line 302, in run
    root_dir = tempfile.mkdtemp(dir=temp_dir)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/tempfile.py", line 339, in mkdtemp
    _os.mkdir(file, 0700)
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/tmp/codalab/tmpTamW0S'    
```

We are not really sure why the "/tmp/codalab/" folder is deleted, nor by "whom" (whether it's the docker deamon, the AWS console or the docker image) but an easy fix, i think, is that in the docker image from codalab for example by checking before `root_dir = tempfile.mkdtemp(dir=temp_dir)` is called a change that the "temp_dir"  (ie "/tmp/codalab") exists and if not to create it, with for example this snippet:
```python
if not os.path.exists(temp_dir):
    os.mkdir(temp_dir)
root_dir = tempfile.mkdtemp(dir=temp_dir)
```
replacing the `root_dir = tempfile.mkdtemp(dir=temp_dir)` line.

This problem has been troubling us for every competitions we have organized with compute workers hosted on AWS.

Thanks for your help

Benjamin

title: Need to uncomment some lines by default in .env_sample
body:
In **develop** (and lri-master) branch, the **.env_sample** file contains the following commented lines:

```
#CHAHUB_API_URL=https://chahub.org/api/v1/
#CHAHUB_API_KEY=some-secret-key
#SOCIAL_AUTH_CHAHUB_BASE_URL=https://chahub.org
```

But when `CHAHUB_API_URL` (and maybe also `SOCIAL_AUTH...`) variables are not defined, we get the following error when trying to run the instance:

![error_lri-master_chahub_env](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11784999/69876316-940aa300-12bf-11ea-968a-693c5766728b.png)

Basically, the error shows that a `CHAHUB_URL` variable is `None`.

**Uncomment the line solve the issue.** We should uncomment them by default if it does not cause any other issue (e.g. with Chahub).

title: Stress testing AutoDL
body: This concerns competition https://autodl.lri.fr/my/competition/115 The queue used is AutoDL-test 10 workers were found running when jobs were set. Workers used for PREDICTION in PHASE 1: ``` + = 1 job OK - = 1 job 1 failed ``` 6978db131c62 6b36a3be1c5b 6e8e97dde3eb + + - 957a9a062d49 - + + 97c3bde8e0a2 + + + - c8100e9699e5 c942406bde3c - + efe067aef3f7 - - - f1bf47b7871d f5a1f19bcda6 + + - Some workers were never assigned to phase 1 and generally seem to be assigned less frequently. There are intermittent errors. Baseline 0 was sent multiple time: https://autodl.lri.fr/my/datasets/download/7b0dc24f-7b4a-4c1a-ba26-4250cd9e3d74 [it computes nothing, only returns constant values] Sometimes it succeeds, sometime it fails: e.g. dataset 4: 3 | April 11, 2019, 6:57 a.m. | guyon | 2375 | baseline0_all_zero (1).zip | Finished | True 4 | April 11, 2019, 7:03 a.m. | guyon | 2387 | baseline0_all_zero (1).zip | Failed | False The failure is: docker: Error response from daemon: OCI runtime create failed: container_linux.go:344: starting container process caused "process_linux.go:424: container init caused \"process_linux.go:407: running prestart hook 1 caused \\\"error running hook: exit status 1, stdout: , stderr: exec command: [/usr/bin/nvidia-container-cli --load-kmods configure --ldconfig=@/sbin/ldconfig.real --device=all --compute --utility --require=cuda>=10.0 brand=tesla,driver>=384,driver<385 --pid=8113 /var/lib/docker/overlay2/3d56ff6e4ad2a6ebe2e91987a196b50e2dbfccedec095b460e692468cdd22f04/merged]\\\\nnvidia-container-cli: initialization error: driver error: failed to process request\\\\n\\\"\"": unknown. The docker used is the same in all cases: finlouarn/st4autodl:cuda10-cudnn7-p3-tf1.13.1 2375 was run with 957a9a062d49 and 6978db131c62 2387 was run with efe067aef3f7 and c8100e9699e5 efe067aef3f7 seems to constantly fail, but 957a9a062d49 not. It is very tedious/impossible to use the current interface to make diagnoses. We need a page summarizing the health status like https://codalab.lri.fr/health/simple_status, but having the following columns: - the competitition name - the participant name - the queue - the submission number - the phase - the compute worker - the docker - the name of the submitted file (with a link to download it) - the description - prediction/scoring - the submission date - the status - the start time - the end time [we need both the start and end time because we suspect there might be an issue with jobs run at the same time]

* Edit any competition (confirmed to happen with fresh sample competition)

320MB | 15min | Failed to unzip
182MB | 10min | Failed to unzip
104MB | Less than 10min | Failed to unzip
40MB | 2min | Zip is ok

It has no metadata, so the ingestion program should call the scoring program directly. So it does. But the result submission is not available to the scoring program in the res/ directory. Instead, the input data has been copied there:

title: Email Participants function mangles newlines
body:
On the "Participants" page of a competition, there is a "Send message to all participants?" button that allows you to compose an e-mail message with a given title and body. This message gets converted into a multi-part MIME e-mail, including a plain text part and an HTML part. The plain text part looks fine, but the HTML part can be horribly formatted, with all the newlines replaced with horizontal whitespace. For example, typing a message such as ``` Dear Participants, Paragraph 1 Paragraph 2 Paragraph 3 Regards, Your friendly neighbourhood competition organizer ``` results in the following e-mail message (in the HTML part): > Dear Participants, Paragraph 1 Paragraph 2 Paragraph 3 Regards, Your friendly neighbourhood competition organizer This makes long messages very hard to read. The problem seems to be that the message processing code simply strips out any HTML tags from the message and then inserts the result verbatim into the two parts of the MIME message. Since HTML treats newlines as horizontal whitespace, all newlines and paragraph breaks are lost. What the code should instead be doing, after stripping out the HTML tags, is to replace all newlines with `
` in the HTML part of the MIME message. (Note that this substitution should not be done for the plain text part!)

title: initial leaderboard column required
body:
there appears to be an undocumented requirement that the first leaderboard column mentioned in a configuration yaml be present in a scored submission. Failure to provide this value leads to an error reported when trying to view that submission in a leaderboard, and triggers unviewable submissions on the admin interface. note that the required column is not necessarily the one with rank 1, but rather the first to appear in the configuration yaml. Furthermore, when an erroneous submission is submitted to the leaderboard, no subsequent submission will succeed.

see 
https://competitions.codalab.org/competitions/15949?secret_key=b891d012-c43e-477c-bb77-b3f00683392a

and

https://competitions.codalab.org/competitions/15950?secret_key=63677e0f-dd32-427a-b635-84ad50f448b5

the only difference between the two is the first has "nfF-score" as the initial column and the second has "bioF-score". In both cases I submitted "mini_devtest_sub" which yields both scores (works fine), "mini_devtest_nf_sub" which yields nfF-score only (only works for the first), "mini_devtest_bio_sub" which yields bioF-score only (only works for the second), then displayed a working submission and resubmitted mini_devtest_sub (works fine), then displayed the nonworking submission and resubmitted mini_devtest_sub (instant failure), then displayed a working submission and resubmitted mini_devtest_sub a final time (works fine).

As a workaround I will ensure that the scoring script always produces values for all columns by displaying dummy values if real values cannot be produced.

https://competitions.codalab.org/my/competition/submission/382758/detailed_results/

title: Organizers cannot see the leaderboard
body:
On competition results page template (_results_page.html) line 11, there is an elseif case that prevents organizers and owners of a competition to see the leaderboard on active phases. The line is: > > {% elif phase.is_future and block_leaderboard_view and is_owner or request.user in competition_admins %} >

This phase has not started yet. The leaderboard is still hidden to participants but visible to you as an organizer

The precedence order (https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/templates/builtins/#complex-expressions), this is interpreted as: (phase.is_future AND block_leaderboard_view AND is_owner) OR (request.user in competition_admins) therefore organizers only see this message instead of the leaderboard.

title: Rich text editor gobbles spaces around <samp>…</samp> tags
body:
The rich text editor in the web interface gobbles all whitespace before and after ``…`` HTML tags. This makes it impossible to use these tags for their intended purpose of showing program input and output. The whitespace-gobbling doesn't initially affect HTML files uploaded as part of competition bundles, but if the competition is ever edited in the web interface, the problem occurs. Sample steps to reproduce: 1. Create a competition bundle containing an `evaluation.html` file containing, say, `

Your answer file must contain 1 in the second column.

`. 2. Create a new competition by uploading the competition bundle. 3. View the competition. The evaluation page is correctly rendered as follows: > Your answer file must contain 1 in the second column. 4. Edit the competition in the web interface. It's not necessary to make any changes; just click on the "Submit" button to save it as-is. 5. View the competition. The evaluation page is now incorrectly rendered as follows: > Your answer file must contain1in the second column. 6. Edit the competition in the web interface. This time, try to re-add spaces around `1` and re-save the competition. 7. View the competition. Despite the latest changes to the evaluation page, it is still rendered incorrectly.

title: Nonsensical "reinstate" button after approving participant

In the "Status" column for that participant, there are two buttons: "reinstate" and "Revoke".  I think the "reinstate" button doesn't make sense here; surely this is something that should appear only after a participant has been revoked, not immediately after they are approved.  After reloading the page, however, the "reinstate" button disappears.

title: Superfluous e-mail notifications when accepting participants
body:
For every participant I accept into one of my CodaLab competitions, I get two separate confirmation e-mails:

> From: CodaLab <info@codalab.org>
> Subject: SomeOtherUser accepted into your competition!
>
> Hello Logological,
> The user SomeOtherUser was accepted into your competition:
> SemEval-2017 Task 7, Subtask 1 Manage participants
>
> Thanks,
> CodaLab Team

> From: CodaLab <info@codalab.org>
> Subject: Accepted into SemEval-2017 Task 7, Subtask 1!
>
> Hello Logological,
> This is a message updating your access to the competition:
> SemEval-2017 Task 7, Subtask 1
> Your status has been accepted!
>
> Thanks,
> CodaLab Team

The first e-mail makes sense, but the second one doesn't.  Why do I always get a message telling me I've been accepted into my own competition?  I hope CodaLab isn't spamming all the other participants with a similar message whenever someone new joins the competition.

title: anonymized leaderboard csv downloads contain user information
body:
discovered and submitted to me by @jflanigan

If the leaderboard is anonymized (anonymous_leaderboard: True), shown (leaderboard_management_mode: show_results) and the phase is active, users can see an anonymized leaderboard and have the option to download a csv. The csv, however, is **not** anonymized; usernames are shown. 

The only workaround I currently have for this bug is to not show the leaderboard but this denies users the ability to view their own scores. Is there a suitable workaround available?

title: incorrect message when attempting to view hidden leaderboard in future phase
body:
originally reported to me by@jflanigan:

If the leaderboard is not going to be shown (leaderboard_management_mode: hide_results) and a phase of the competition has not started yet, when attempting to view the leaderboard this message is printed:

"This phase has not started yet. The leaderboard is still hidden to participants but visible to you as an organizer"

This is printed even if the user is not an organizer. The text appears to be the only thing that is buggy; no information that shouldn't be shown is shown.

title: Reference data error when publishing a competition
body:
Ticket #1622 brought to my attention the following: 
- `Reference_data` is not required within the `yaml` file, meaning competition will be created properly. However, publishing the competition `throws` an error because of missing link to `reference_data`. We can't throw an error when publishing the competition if we bypass them during creation. Possible solutions:

- [ ] Make sure `yaml` file checks for `reference_data`
- [ ] Allow submission to be published withouth requiring `reference_data` to all phases. 
- [ ] I consider `first phase` should always have `reference_data`.  Check it during creating and when publishing.

title: Incorrect "manage" link upon uploading a competition bundle
body: After successfully uploading a new competition bundle, the web interface prints the following message: > Congratulations! Your new competition is ready to view. You can also manage it from your CodaLab dashboard. The problem is that the second hyperlink goes to `/my/#manage`, whereas there is no such anchor on that page. If the user clicks on it, he or she will be directed to the main "My Competitions" page, which is still, rather inconveniently, one click away from the tab for managing the user's own competitions. The actual anchor is `#my_managing`.

title: Several and different errors when submitting
body:
I try to create a competition, it seemed to work fine, but when I try to submit an answer.zip containing a file answer.txt to test it, the submission fails: it displays several and different error messages for the same file submitted successively.

For example, I get :

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/azureuser/codalab/codalab/codalabtools/compute/worker.py", line 348, in run
    env=os.environ
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 710, in __init__
    errread, errwrite)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 1327, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception
OSError: [Errno 13] Permission denied
```

or 

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/azureuser/codalab/codalab/codalabtools/compute/worker.py", line 348, in run
    env=os.environ
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 710, in __init__
    errread, errwrite)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 1327, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory
```

or

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/azureuser/codalab/codalab/codalabtools/compute/worker.py", line 255, in run
    shutil.rmtree(file_path)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/shutil.py", line 247, in rmtree
    rmtree(fullname, ignore_errors, onerror)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/shutil.py", line 256, in rmtree
    onerror(os.rmdir, path, sys.exc_info())
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/shutil.py", line 254, in rmtree
    os.rmdir(path)
OSError: [Errno 39] Directory not empty: '/codalabtemp/tmpo3gREj/run'
```

To be sure that it was not my scoring program which was buggy, I replaced it with an "example" scoring program, and get same error messages. Here is the scoring program:

```
#!/usr/bin/env python
import sys
import os
import os.path

input_dir = sys.argv[1]
output_dir = sys.argv[2]

submit_dir = os.path.join(input_dir, 'res')
truth_dir = os.path.join(input_dir, 'ref')

if not os.path.isdir(submit_dir):
    print "%s doesn't exist" % submit_dir

if os.path.isdir(submit_dir) and os.path.isdir(truth_dir):
    if not os.path.exists(output_dir):
        os.makedirs(output_dir)

    output_filename = os.path.join(output_dir, 'scores.txt')
    output_file = open(output_filename, 'wb')

    truth_file = os.path.join(truth_dir, "answer.txt")
    truth = open(truth_file).read()

    submission_answer_file = os.path.join(submit_dir, "answer.txt")
    submission_answer = open(submission_answer_file).read()

    if truth == submission_answer:
        output_file.write("Difference:1")
    else:
        output_file.write("Difference:0")

    output_file.close()
```

title: Submissions are stuck when participants upload them to CodaLab
body:
Hi CodaLab,

we are running two CIKM Cup 2016 data science competitions on CodaLab right now: https://competitions.codalab.org/competitions/11171 and https://competitions.codalab.org/competitions/11161.

And, recently participants started to experience difficulties with getting their solutions scored. When they upload their submissions, the processing takes an excessively long amount of time (15min - 1hour). It limits the number of submissions that the participants can do per day and decreases their user experience on CodaLab (and transitively, satisfaction with the CIKM Cup). 

Can you please take a look at it and if possible increase the server capacity.

Thanks,
Nik (CIKM Cup 2016 Co-Chair)

title: Submission that breaks the competition site!
body:
I made a submission to:
https://competitions-test.codalab.org/competitions/1128?secret_key=e93d72ee-3217-4112-a804-7af6d3a3edf5

After that, the leader board showed this message:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./apps/web/views.py", line 535, in get_context_data
    context['groups'] = phase.scores()
  File "./apps/web/models.py", line 940, in scores
    computed_values[id] = sum([ranks[d.id][id] for d in computed_deps[sdef.id]]) / float(cnt)
KeyError: 2852L

It is impossible to kill the guilty submission because the submission panel

As can be seen, several submissions were successfully made before that, this was a functioning competition.

title: Menus for datasets in competition editor
body:
The Input data / Reference data / Scoring program menus in the editor should display only relevant datasets. When adding a phase, I got:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7594063/9270412/76726404-4226-11e5-8aa6-7d10bc90ba39.png)

For "Input data",  "Reference data", and "Scoring program" I had the same menu, indicating all possible data bundles from all users. Rather we need to display only the data bundles uploaded by the logged in user currently editing (either the owner or an authorized admin), and only the data bundles of the right nature: "Input data",  "Reference data", or "Scoring program". Currently, for instance, we can select inout data from the menu of scoring programs.

formerly #1206

title: Uncaught broken pipe error when user connection drops
body:
When I refresh a page many times, the browser presumably closes old sockets mid-response, which leads to this error on the server:

```
[12/Nov/2015 11:43:44] "GET /worksheets/0x026f9e00792943c1b16e199444091cd2/ HTTP/1.1" 200 10597
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/wsgiref/handlers.py", line 86, in run
    self.finish_response()
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/wsgiref/handlers.py", line 128, in finish_response
    self.write(data)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/wsgiref/handlers.py", line 212, in write
    self.send_headers()
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/wsgiref/handlers.py", line 270, in send_headers
    self.send_preamble()
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/wsgiref/handlers.py", line 197, in send_preamble
    self._write('Server: %s\r\n' % self.server_software)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/socket.py", line 328, in write
    self.flush()
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/socket.py", line 307, in flush
    self._sock.sendall(view[write_offset:write_offset+buffer_size])
error: [Errno 32] Broken pipe
[12/Nov/2015 11:43:44] "GET /worksheets/0x026f9e00792943c1b16e199444091cd2/ HTTP/1.1" 500 59
```

Doesn't cause any problems besides extra log errors, but it would be good to catch/handle it.

title: handle binary files in bundles
body:
Currently, if we try to get the contents of a binary file, we throw an exception.
UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf8' codec can't decode byte 0x90 in position 24: invalid start byte

Should be able to get the binary contents, but on the interface, should not show the binary contents - just write '(binary file)'.  How to test for this?

title: edit / save doesn't return focus
body:
On master: if press 'e' to start editing a worksheet, then 'ctrl-enter' to save, then the cursor position vanishes and j/k don't work.  If click 'edit source' to edit a worksheet, then the cursor position still vanishes but the keys work.

Desired behavior: cursor position should be restored and the keys should work.

title: MISSING field values in worksheet are somewhat inconsistent
body:
In worksheet tables, some field values are marked as MISSING, but the criteria for showing MISSING instead of a blank cell is somewhat inconsistent.

```
% add mem1 memory
% add mem2 memory size
% add mem3 memory %d
% add mem4 memory s/0/z
% add mem5 memory "%s | s/0/z"
% add |
```

![scr](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5135317/10467424/6e7c935c-71ae-11e5-8b92-897076baaf08.png)

As a result, the divider (`add |`) appears wider than it should be since the cell shows the word MISSING.

title: Test compute workers out of sync?
body:
One of the test compute workers is working fine. The other compute worker seems to be using either a different Python binary or is not completely up-to-date. I believe it was completely up-to-date before recent monitoring changes.

Submissions will fail on the out of sync worker with missing packages, but the other worker will process them fine.

title: scope of worksheet directives too long
body:
Worksheet directives should only apply on the subsequent set of consecutive bundles, but currently the extent is longer.  So

```
% display table run
this text should break the continuity
{bundle B}
```

Currently, B is displayed like a run, but shouldn't be.

title: Inconsistency between raw edit and cl upload
body:
The following procedure may cause bundle without host worksheet
1. On website, you enter raw edit mode.
2. In command line, you upload a bundle. If you `cl ls` at this moment, you can see the bundle is successfully uploaded and appears at the bundle list.
3. You switch back to view mode. After updating according to plaintext in raw edit, the just-uploaded bundle is missing.

This inconsistency may cause bundle without host worksheet.

Reference bundle: https://www.codalab.org/bundles/0x8d63b4b6feb3433cae5b152623fa64e5/
Sidenote: `cl wedit` does not have this problem.

# Equations ($\LaTeX$)
Adding stuff ($a_1$ and $b^2$, but not $\hat{c}$) gives $$S = a_1 + b^2$$, which is nice.

title: Learderboard hiding bug
body:
There is a feature that is no longer working:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7594063/5385522/08f3c29e-8091-11e4-8833-f938c7618f06.png)
There is a menue that allows you to hide the leaderboard results:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7594063/5385538/3238ef3a-8091-11e4-93a8-f88dda9f655a.png)
But when it is active, the results are still shown on the leaderboard.

It would be great to make that work again because sometimes when a "final" phase starts it takes a loooong time before the all results are computed (and possibly verified). It is best to wait until everything is ready, then show the whole result table. Thus we need to hide the leaderboard and let the organizers switch to showing the results when everything is OK.

title: Lag in moving rows within a table
body:
The first time you move a row inside a table, everything works fine. Subsequent times, the rowFocusIndex updates immediately, but the content of the table waits for the ajax get call (fetch_and_update) to return before updating its state and re-rendering.

See https://github.com/codalab/codalab/blob/feature/worksheet_interface/codalab/apps/web/static/js/worksheet/ws_mixins.js#L33-34

title: Extra HTML pages not created from Competition.yaml
body:
When you create a competition, if your competition bundle includes additional html pages, they are not created because the unpack method does not look for pages in addition to the basic required pages.

The work around for now is to create a competition then add pages through the editor, however this should be fixed.

title: Creating competition with invalid definition creates a competition entry
body:
Creating competition with invalid definition fails during upload but still creates a competition entry.

Repro Steps:
1. Clone the https://github.com/codalab/competition-examples repo
2. Create a zip file with the contents of compute_pi. Make sure the zip does NOT contain a program.zip file, this makes this definition file invalid.
3. Create a competition using the invalid definition

Notice: Competition fails, this is expected.
1. Navigate to "Competitions I'm Running"

Actual: Invalid competition is listed.
Expected: Prevent creation of the invalid competition.

title: Update home page text
body:
Some variation of:
CodaLab is an open-source web-based platform that enables people to share code and data in order to advance the state of the art in research fields where Machine Learning is used. CodaLab focuses on:
• Reducing the amount of time that researchers spend on preprocessing datasets, writing evaluation or visualization scripts, and getting other people’s code to run
• Reducing duplicated efforts across different groups
• Enabling the creation of competitions to help focus the community on areas needing benchmarking or better methods
CodaLab helps solve these problems by creating an online community where people share worksheets or participate in competitions. CodaLab Worksheets lower the barrier to documenting and publishing detailed experiments, streamlining the research and learning process. CodaLab nurtures an environment of scientific rigor by enabling reproducibility and transparency, and it opens new avenues for collaboration between researchers, developers, and data scientists.

     3.  Use touch to Sign Out

![bug 54572 - sign in misalign](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5091775/964346/f53e92ae-0514-11e3-91d5-68d5343fa2ab.png)

Steps:
     1. Launch CodaLab  (http://cl-test1-ubuntu.cloudapp.net/help/about.html)
     2. Select a competition

title: Deleting a competition doesn't have referential integrity
body:
Deleting a competition from the delete button works.
When creating a new competition (after deleting one), the new competition id collides with the deleted competition id for all associated data that was not deleted when the competition was.

We need to ensure we delete all associated data when we delete the competition.

Steps to reproduce:
- Load up a fresh codalab following the instructions
- delete the competition via the ui
- run the competition.py script to recreate a competition (it will fail currently and shouldn't fail)

There should be real test for this that can be automated.
